body_html:
If you're using a custom estimator, and supplying your own model_fn, you can call init_from_checkpoint. The checkpoint_dir arg can be different from your model_dir, and assignment_map allows you to map only the subset of variables you want to load.

Here's the API doc for 1.1, in 1.2 it will be available as tf.train.init_from_checkpoint.
tensorflow.org/api_docs/python/tf/contrib/framework/init_from_checkpoint
body_text:
If you're using a custom estimator, and supplying your own model_fn, you can call init_from_checkpoint. The checkpoint_dir arg can be different from your model_dir, and assignment_map allows you to map only the subset of variables you want to load.
Here's the API doc for 1.1, in 1.2 it will be available as tf.train.init_from_checkpoint.
tensorflow.org/api_docs/python/tf/contrib/framework/init_from_checkpoint
body:
If you're using a custom estimator, and supplying your own model_fn, you can call `init_from_checkpoint`. The `checkpoint_dir` arg can be different from your `model_dir`, and `assignment_map` allows you to map only the subset of variables you want to load.

Here's the API doc for 1.1, in 1.2 it will be available as tf.train.init_from_checkpoint.
tensorflow.org/api_docs/python/tf/contrib/framework/init_from_checkpoint
